result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven E. Dolan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Operation/Vehicle, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.10(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Defendant, with assistance of his probation agent, to identify two methods to increase highway safety public awareness.  Must be for a non-profit organization.  Agent to assist in finding the most impactful means to get the message out.

To be paid on an monthly basis during the term of probation.  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to serve 2 weeks jail, each year, starting at 6:00 P.M, October 19th.   May serve in another county.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven E. Dolan

time for circuit court to determine the postconviction motion is retroactively extended to 9/24/18.  NOA due by 10/15/18.
2.  Dr. S.G.O. report
1.   Dr. S.G.O. Curriculum Vitae.

District Attorney Daniel S. Diehn appeared on behalf of the State. Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Ruby.  Victim notification complied with.  Defense motion for postconviction relief.  Defendant waived his right to confidentiality in regards Attorney S.'s representation for the purposes of this hearing.   Defense called Attorney S., sworn by the Clerk.  Defense examined the witness.  Witness has reviewed the filings in regard to this motion.  Witness explained the theory of defense he used in this case.  Questioned regarding cases cited and case law, regarding the traffic violations committed by the defendant, regarding the issue of intent.  What/when medical conditions were discussed with the defendant.  What research he did regarding the medications.  Defendant's medical records were not reviewed by the witness.  Did not contact any medical experts.  Witness explained reasoning behind the decision not to bring up medications.  Any research done regarding seizures.  What the defendant told him regarding the effects of the medications he was taking at the time of the accident.   State examined the witness.  Questioned regarding use of the word intent with the jury, cases cited in the defense motion.  Defenses discussed with the defendant.  He used what he believed what was the best defense available.  Defense redirect. Intent word use with the jury questioned.  Break at 10:12 am.  10:25 resume.  Defense called B.D., sworn by the clerk.  Defendant is his father.  Questioned about telephone conversations with his father.  Riding in a vehicle with his father.  State questioned the witness.  Telephone conversations with his father.  Defense called Dr. O., sworn by the clerk.  Assistant Clinical Professor in Pharmacy at UW WI Madison.  PHD in Pharmacology from the UW of MN.  Researched at the Mayo Clinic.  Exhibit 1 marked.  Doctor's CV.  Defense moved for admission of exhibit 1.  No objection.  Admitted.  Questioned regarding seizures, awareness of having a seizure, seizure from medications.  Exhibit 2 marked.  Doctor's report.  Defense moved for admission of exhibit 2.  No objection.  Admitted.  Questioned on drugs defendant was taking and how they may interact, defendant's medical history. His conclusion is that minor seizures occurred.  State cross examined the witness.  Accident caused by petit mal seizures is his opinion.  Other conditions that may cause seizures.  Defense has no redirect.  Defense called the defendant, sworn by the clerk.  Questioned about medications he was taking prior to the crash.  He was not told about seizure side effect possibility.  No other accidents during that time period.  Conversations with his son.  State questioned the defendant. No redirect by the defense.  No further witnesses.  State made argument to the court.  Defense made argument to the court.  Court denied defense motion for post conviction relief.
printed out relevant motions/reply for Judge Becker and sent to JA.
Court advised that Atty Sheets is not available for MPRH scheduled for 5/23/18; rescheduled to 9/6/18 which is earliest date which will work for all parties.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing on September 6, 2018 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: 1 & 2. Exhibit 2 not scanable.  DVD.
Associated with Charge #1

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sheets.  Victim notification complied with, per State.  Defense has the victim impact statements and restitution information.  Restitution worksheet reviewed.  Defense is not contesting the amount of restitution requested.  Victim's brother and father are present.  They will not be making an oral statement.  Exhibit 1 offered by State.  Photo.  No objection.  Admitted.  Exhibit 2 offered by State.  Video of the victim's wife.  State made sentencing argument.  Recommends probation, 5 years.  Pay restitution.  Drive a motor vehicle only if agent permits.  Jail time on the anniversary of the crash.  Make a PSA for the DOT.   Attorney Sheets made sentencing argument.  Recommends 2-3 years probation.  No conditional jail.   Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 5 years.  Conditions:  Pay restitution.  $11,309.37.  Pay monthly during probation.  Revoked DL for 1 year.  Alcohol assessment and DSP.  DNA sample and surcharge.  CC     The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Jail each year during probation, starting 6:00 pm each Oct 19th, for 2 weeks.  May serve in another County.  Identify 2 methods on how you can assist public safety.  Increase public awareness.  For a non-profit organization.  Agent to assist in finding the most impactful means to get the message out.  Felony warnings given to the defendant.
Restitution Worksheet.
Sentencing hearing at 01-28-2016 10:30 am

1 - 19 (There was not a #9 presented and #13 withdrawn)
Guilty of homicide by negligent operation of a vehicle, contrary to Section 940.10(1)
Verdict - not signed

Re-convened with jury present at 8:29 a.m.  All parties are present.  Judge reads opening  jury instructions.  Closing arguments begin at 8:46.  Jury out at 9:35 after DA Fax requested a sidebar.  Court reporter reads back attorney Sheets last remarks in his closing argument.  DA Fox gives his argument to his objection.  He requests the jury be instructed to disregard his interpretation of the law, his last statement.  Attorney Sheets states his argument.  More discussion by both counsel.  Jury back.  Attorney Sheets clarifies/corrects his statements to the jury regarding the law.  Closing arguments end at 9:48.  Judge finishes final closing jury instructions.  The The alternate jurors are excused.  Jury baliffs are sworn.  Jury out to deliberate at 9:54.  No objections to jury instructions as read.  Will address at the time if jurors requests exhibits.  Court in recess.  Jury has verdict at 11:53.  Back on record at 11:57.  Exhibit 12 is made part of the record but was not admitted.  Jury back in at 11:58.  Verdict is guilty.  Court polls the individual jurors of their verdict.  All answer "yes" that it is their verdict as read.  Court enters finding of guilty.  Judge notifies jurors they do not need to speak to anyone about this case if they do not wish to do so.  Judge thanks the jurors.  Jurors out.  Sentencing will be scheduled by counsel with Judge's office.  Neither DA Fox or defense counsel believes a PSI is necessary but is up to the Court.  Judge Becker states she will not order a PSI.  Attorneys to do a phone conference with Judge's office next week to schedule sentencing.  Bond is continued.

In Chambers:  DA Fox states counsel has agreed upon specific photos to be used today.  They will be marked as Exhibit 8 - Trooper Hanson's photos - #'s 0206, 0209, 0224, 0225, 0231, 0232, 0234, 0248, 0249, 0273, 0513, 0518, 0521, 0534, 0554, 0591, 0592, 0593, 0595, 0596, 0598, 0602, 0606, 0608, 0609, 0613, 0624, 0625, 0633, 0636, 0638, 0640, 0651.  Attorney Sheets agrees.  Exhibits 1 - 6 are all offered/admitted if not already done.  No objection from defense.  Judge discussed how media is being handled today.  There was a distraction yesterday and she wasn't aware that any of the media present had gotten prior permission from the media coordinator.  
Back on record at 8:35 with jury present.  Defense counsel examines witness Trooper S. W., who is still under oath.  Re-direct of witness by DA Fox.   State presents Exhibit #11 - Defendant's written statement displayed on TV monitor.  Witness testifies regarding defendant's statement.  Exhibit #11 offered/admitted.  Testimony continues with cross and re-direct examination.  This witness is released from subpoena.  State calls witness Trooper R. K., sworn, testifies.  Exhibit #14 - R.K.'s Curriculum Vitae.  Exhibit #14 offered/admitted.  Exhibit #7 - photos/video of defendant's truck inside and out.  Witness testifies to mechanical condition of defendant's vehicle.  There was no evidence that the braking system wasn't in working condition.  The vehicle was in very good mechanical condition.  Defense counsel Sheets performs cross-exam of witness.  Witness released.  Exhibit #7 offered/admitted.  Short break.  State calls witness, Trooper M.M., sworn, testifies.  Exhibit #15 - M.M.'s Curriculum Vitae.  Exhibit #15 offered/admitted.  Witness testifies regarding his interview of defendant at his residence.  That interview was recorded by witness and he explained the process/results of the interview.  He cooperated and there as a gap in his memory for a stretch of time before the accident.  Defense counsel Sheets cross-examines the witness.  Re-direct by DA Fox.  Refers witness to Exhibit #3, testifies.  Defense objects to question regarding medication's possible use for seizures.  Jury out - DA to give offer of proof outside of jury.  Proceeds with questionining of witness to get offer of proof.  Judge finds there was no previous evidence of any seizure/medical issue.  State withdraws the question.  Jury back and questioning of witness continues.  Re-cross of witness by defense.  Witness is released from subpoena.  Will recess for lunch and re-convene at 1:00.  Judge admonishes jurors to not have any contact with any media or to do any research.  Back on record at 12:58 p.m.  State calls Trooper D. H., sworn, testifies.  State marks Exhibit #16, Trooper D.H.'s Curriculum Vitae.  Testifies to education/training.  Exhibit #16 offered/admitted.  Witness gives overview of crash reconstruction process.  Explains what happens when he first gets on scene and what/how information is collected.  DA Fox presents Exhibit #8 - Trooper Hanson's photos on DVD.  Witness testifies to photos (image #'s listed previously) as displayed on TV monitor.  Exhibit #8 offered/admitted.  Exhibit #12 - Trooper D.H.'s photos of defendant's truck:  Image # 0006.  Exhibit #17 marked - photo of fabric pattern on pickup truck.  Exhibit #17 offered/admitted/published.  DA Fox shows/publishes photo to jury panel.  Exhibit #18 marked - Photo of pickup front bumper with fabric pattern - offered/admitted and published to jury.  Witness explains to jury what position the victim was in at time of impact and what the injuries consisted of.  Exhibit #10 Bosch Crash Data - displayed on TV monitor for witness to testify and explain what it's showing.  Exhibit #10 offered/admitted.  Testifies there is a peer review process before submitting completed written report of crash reconstruction.  Exhibit #19 marked - Trooper D.H.'s Written Crash Reconstruction Report.  Witness testifies to portions of report.  Witness states the conclusion for the cause of this crash - the pickup crossed the fog line; victim was in a downward position and was struck by the pickup.  Exhibit 19 and Exhibit 10 offered and received. Defense counsel Sheets examines witness.  DA Fox re-direct of witness.  Exhibit #13 marked - Pamphlet.  Side-bar of counsel.  Exhibit #13 was not introduced or testified to by witness.  DA Fox continues re-direct questioning of witness.  Defense counsel continues to cross-examine witness.  More re-direct of witness by DA Fox.  Trooper is subject to recall.  So ordered.  Exhibit #12 ws not offered and Exhibit #13 was not offered/admitted and is withdrawn by DA Fox.  Exhibit #9 was never introduced.  State rests.  Break - jury out.  Defense counsel to discuss with his client if they will have any witnesses.  Back on record with jury still out.  Attorney Sheets will not be presenting any witnesses.  Court will instruct the jury this is the close of evidence and there will no witnesses by defense.  Judge performs colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify or not.  He states he will not testify.  Defendant knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily waives his right to testify.  Jury back in.  Defense rests and have no additional witnesses to call.  Court finds this is the close of the trial.  Jurors excused for the day.  Judge admonishes jury not to read any media, watch news, or research this case.  Jury out - to return tomorrow at 8:30.  Defense makes a motion for directed judgment.  DA Fox objects and states his argument.  Sheets also states his argument.  Court will leave decision to jury.  No directed verdict - motion is denied.  Jury instruction conference held.  H.Z. present to make notation of changes.  Date change will be made to verdicts.  112 - will be taken out; 925 - will come out; 772 - all caps will be removed but will remain, underlining to be removed; 247 - will be out; 162 - will take out; 165 - will take out; 270- will come out; 275 - will come out; 158 - will come out; 150 - will come out; 300 - last section to be taken out; 330 - take out; 201 - will add additional text; 320 - out; 325 - out; 327 - out; wording to be changed on verdicts and underlining will be removed; not guilty verdict will be read first; 520 - will not be included in the binder that goes to the jury.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Trooper Steven Wojcik to appear at jury trial November 18 - 20, 2015.

Minutes taken in chambers prior to trial were taken by A.P.:  Judge states he's concerned about a rumor of possibly a large number of tow trucks coming in support of victim's family.  Sheriff is in contact as this could jepordize a fair trial.  Discused how the situation would be handled if it occurs.  Discussed types of questions attorneys will be asking during voir dire.  Discussed witness list.  Went over Motions in Limine.  Judge reviewed charges/penalties with defenant.  He understood.  Discussed pre-trial offer made by DA to defendant.  Defendant understands offer and wishes to proceed with jury trial.  Judge states he will give a stern warning to jurors not to use any social media during the duration of the trial.  Mintues by D.J.:  Voir dire oath given to all jurors.  Judge reads the Information to jurors.  Voir dire begins at 9:19 a.m.  Jury selection is completed at 12:07.  Panel is sworn.  Judge admonishes jurors to not talk to anyone about the case, the parties, or to research the case, or to go to the site.  Adjourn until 1:30.  Back on the record at 1:34.  Judge begins preliminary jury instructions.  Opening statements begin at 1:46 p.m. and end at 2:11 p.m.  State calls witness, R.J., sworn, testifies.  State marks Exhibit 1, photo of victim and his family, offerred/received/published to jury.  Defense counsel questions witness.  State refers to Exhibit 2 - photo disk - and refers to only 1 photo at this time; questions witness regarding that photo.  Re-cross of witness by defense.  Witness is released from subpoena.  State calls next witness, M.L., sworn/testifies.  State marks Exhibit 3 - Lab Report of Defendant - Exhibit 3 is offered/received/published to jury.  Defense counsel questions witness.  Witness is released from subpoena.  Short break.  State calls next witness, Trooper S. W., sworn/testifies.  State presents Exhibit 4 - Trooper's dash cam video, plays video; witness gives tesitmony as to what is in DVD.  Record reflects the witness has ID'd the defendant.  State presents Exhibit 5 - Tow Truck Video; witness testifies to contents of video.  Witness continues to testify - correct time of accident is 8:16 a.m. not 9:16 a.m. as indicated on tow truck video.  Exhibit 6 - Trooper's photos - witness testiifes to photos on TV screen; Image 1184 - image offered and received; Image 1187 - Image offered/received; Image 1205 - offered/received; Image 1212  offered/received.  Recess at 4:30 and will begin with defense questioning witness.  Judge admonishes jurors to not discuss the case, no research, or go to the scene.  Will begin at 8:30 tomorrow.  Jury out.  Judge states there is a TV station that wants to be present tomorrow but unable to contact DCA.  Judge states SCR 61 - media must give advance notice.  Judge will have staff address the TV station making the request.  Defense counsel objects to having camera present and states his argument.  Court will not allow any additional live feeds unless the Media Coordinator has already given permission.  Meet in Chambers at 8:15.  Discussion of possibly burning photos to a disk presented today and possibly tomorrow.  Judge orders they will addres those issues tomorrow.

Parties will agree to what photos will be used at trial.  No hearings needed before trial on the motions.  Defense wants an accident jury instruction.  That can be taken care of in chambers.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Attorney Sheets appeared by telephone.  The defendant did not appear.  Parties do not have an agreement.  Set for 3 day JT.  Parties agree there will be only the stock motions filed before trial.  No need for Motion hearings to be held before trial.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Attorney Sheets appeared by telephone.  Defendant did not appear.  DA Fox referenced a letter that Attorney Sheets sent to him in regards to the accident.  Attorney Fox is sending that letter to his accident reconstructionist.  STC set for 5/18/15 at 3 p.m.  Attorney Sheets may appear by phone.

Information was filed.  Defense waives reading of the Information and enters a not guilty plea.  Court accepts the not guilty plea and sets a pretrial for 4-8-15 at 9:00 and a status conference for 4-27-15 at 3:00.

Defendant appeared with counsel Eric Sheets.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  DA called witness #1, sworn and testified.  Record reflects ID of defendant by witness.  DA called witness #2, sworn and testified.  DA moved for bind over.  Defensen argues that it comes down to wether it's criminal negligence and refers to the statute.  Court finds ample evidence and binds over for trial.
